title: Box And Cover, "Powder Box with Accordion Player", 1931 or later
markings: Marks: On underside of lid: hammer, sickle, cog hand-painted in blue overglaze
provenance: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection
creditline: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds
description: Cylindrical in shape, straight sides; the figures of a male accordion player and a woman seated sculpted on top of lid; painted in polychrome enamels, gilded bands around upper and lower edges of base and lid.

tombstone.epitaph:
Box And Cover, "Powder Box with Accordion Player", 1931 or later.
1931 or later. Porcelain, enamel, gilding. The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds. 1989-41-81-a,b.
